Even know this game is old, I suggest you play it. This game have puzzles, They are a different story.They start with simple levels to complex, some level are just extremely hard, then it goes back to hard (e.g.: Let say i play level 15, It was hard but when you compelete it, you got to 16, Which is extremely hard then complete that, 17 is hard) But it very short, which stink cause the level are so good. Es una maravilla de principio a fin. Si no lo has visto nunca será algo nuevo, fascinante, fresco... en fin, es corto y algo fácil. La sensación de querer más no se sacia con los mapas más complejos ni con los mapas de desafío (que los complejos cuestan pero los desafíos llegan a desesperar incluso con guías si quieres esa medalla de oro). 

Esta lleno de secretos y zonas en las que te preguntarás que qué haces aquí.
 
Además tendrás la posibilidad de hacer amigos para toda la vida! [i](cubo de compañia <3)[/i]

Y lo mejor es que tiene una segunda parte igual de buena o mejor: [b]Portal 2[/b]

J'ai attendu un moment pour commencer ce jeu. Sa réputation le précède et vraiment, même après tant d'années après sa sortie, il vaut vraiment le coup d'être fait.
Il n'est pas nécessairement long à terminer (si on ne compte pas les salles bonus) et la difficulté n'est pas particulièrement relevée mais une bonne immersion et un gameplay plaisants sont au rendez-vous :-)
Je le recommande vivement à tous ceux qui sont en r e t a r d comme moi et qui ne l'ont toujours pas fait. Avec les soldes steam ou des bundle, cet opus est fréquemment accessible à bon prix donc à ne pas hésiter ;-)
A game with unique concept and storyline. Get it only when it is on sales.
j'adore cette jeux portal être réflexion XD
Awsome But Hard

For me is really hard to judge this game because I've played this for the first time now in 2014, after I had played the sequence Portal 2, which is way better than this one. But still this was something new, something exiting, which made me think a lot about Aperture Science Laboratories which I'm really interested in. I love the idea of being a test subject whose quest is to solve puzzles using portal gun. This game is not hard, it's pretty easy, but funny and I enjoyed every minute of it. I think this game was a huge innovation in game industry. 

7.5 /10

Everything it sets out to do, it does extremely well. Despite being only a few hours long, at no point does it feel rushed, incomplete, or anti-climatic. The levels present the story with subtle and organic touches. There is no need for immersion-breaking exposition as it is either an obvious bit of the setting itself or it's cleverly woven in as a part of the puzzle or scenery. Very little information is given about the protagonist which works to further immerse the player in the role. If you pay attention you can learn her name and appearance, but there's no background or dialogue for her. And with no one to respond to anything she would say, you are free to be her voice yourself. While the story component is fantastic for a game so short, what makes Portal great is well-designed puzzles centered around an interesting gimmick. Portal travel shifts physics in such a way as to make the impossible slightly more possible, that is all. As a gimmick it has a strong root in real concepts and only twists the familiar, thus providing a new way to look at a law that governs our lives. The frequency of puzzles can increase later in the game as you'll find their solutions second nature, so they won't slow you down. You'll have started to think with portals.
I havent been playing this game for very long and its the best game i have played in a while.Totally recomend it. Its great.

I have only played a small bit on steam but I am having TONS of Frustrational fun!  Definitely a must play puzzle game!  It keeps your brain a working and tests the mettle of your patience.  I'm trying to beat this game soon so I can hurry up and play the co-op on Portal with my friends! XD Have fun pulling your hair, making colored stains that take you beyond time and dimensions, sweating your mind away, killing innocent cameras, ignorlistening to the voices in your head, dropping strange cubes and dodging balls of electric fury! Oh, did I mention falling through endless pits? XD
simplemente maravilloso
Makes you use your brain! If you have one, obviously.

Sehr gut, Valve!

Ich habe mir Portal 1 &2 vor einigen Monaten mal im Bundle gekauft, beide Spiele aber bisher kaum angerührt.

Als ich mal wieder meine Bibliothek durchblickte, entdeckte ich diese beiden Spiele und ludt beide sofort runter. Angefangen hab ich natürlich mit dem ersten Teil und ich muss nach dem Spielen sagen: Ein richtig gutes Spiel!

Die Rätsel sind anfangs noch relativ einfach und beinhalten auch ein Tutorial, nach und nach werden diese aber deutlich schwerer, aber immer noch mit etwas überlegen schaffbar.

Die Story ist mit viel Humor gespickt und das Ende gefällt mir ebenfalls sehr gut. Allerdings gibt es nicht sehr viele Kapitel, wobei man das Spiel daher leider schon nach einigen Stunden beendet haben dürfte. Ich empfehle, beide Teile auf einmal zu kaufen und direkt nacheinander zu spielen! :)

Mir hat das Spiel auf jeden Fall sehr viel Spaß bereitet und ich würde es jedem, der Rätsel-Spiele mag, weiterempfehlen.
Take it from me, shit's good.

This is one of my favorite games on Steam. If you are new to Steam, then you should buy either The Portal Bundle or The Orange Box. Portal, and Portal 2 are pretty easy to pick up and play and offer mind boggling puzzles and challenges. If you like physics games and puzzles, then this is the game for you.

If you like puzzles, you will like portal. Portal gives a lot of satisfaction when solving a puzzle, it also makes you feel smarter. A thing I really like about the game is that it includes a really good story, unlike most puzzle games.

The Bonus Maps and Advanced Chambers add a bit of Replayabiliy, and it's fun seeing how fast you can do chambers. Definitely worth the Money. ^u^

Не побоюсь этого слова - классика. Причём классика от самой VALVe, которая может производить не только добротные шутеры, но и столь же добротные головоломки. Да-да-да, я знаю, что такой инновационный геймплей был создан не компанией VALVe, а создателями игры Narbacular Drop, про которую, к сожалению, сейчас мало кто помнит. А сейчас перейдём к самой Portal.
Что касается сюжета - тут он прост как банка пива. Проходим 20 тестовых испытаний(не 19, а 20, потому что первая камера имеет номер 00) под наставления GLaDOs - суперкомпьютера с женским голосом, которая за управление Aperture Science наградила своих создателей смертельными дозами нейротоксина. Так вот, проходим все тестовые камеры, понимаем, что GLaDOS хочет нас убить, сбегаем, а потом ликвидируем этот суперкомпьютер. Ах да, а ещё слушаем в титрах небезызвестную Still Alive. К слову, сама песня раньше была довольна популярна и даже вырвалась за пределы игры, став чуть ли не самостоятельным мемом. Ещё одним мемом была фраза The Cake is a Lie. Тот самый торт, к которому нас торопила GLaDOS и который оказался ложью. Впрочем, торт один раз можно увидеть в самом конце игры. 
Правда, у игры есть один недостаток - это её продожительность. Автор этого обзора умудрился пройти игру за 42 минуты 55 секунд, хотя на YouTube можно найти и видео, на которых прохождение Portal занимает не меньше 10 минут. Но надо заметить: Даг Ломбарди, один из работников VALVe, заявил, что Portal является лишь экспериметом, а её сиквел - полноценной игрой. И с этим нельзя не согласиться.

Вердикт: эксперимент удался!
Оценка: 9,5 из 10

Apesar da curta duração, o aspeto mais notável de Portal reside no constante desafio, um espicaçar permanente do intelecto, num esquema que radica, em última instância, numa luta pela sobrevivência, atordoando o jogador quando é preciso, com novas regras e elementos que destilam o óbvio do subentendido para se vencer mais uma câmara de laboratório, posto que o jogador circula como um rato.

Si no conoces la saga, preparate para un juego muy original, con una mecánica divertida y que te hace pensar como resolver puzzles de la mejor manera posible.

Pros:
-La historia es divertida, hay unos buenos comentarios por parte de tu supervisor ;-) 
-La dificultad aumenta según avanzas las cámaras, y por si te gustan los retos, hay dos modos aparte: uno en que repites pantallas pero con unos desafios concretos; y otro en que te enfrentas a unas cámaras pero con mucha más complejidad.
-Hay varios secretos, que permiten una experiencia más completa
-The companion cube, ya lo descubriréis

Contras:
-El juego se hace corto, si sólo te dedicas a la historia principal en unas pocas horas puedes habertelo pasado. Aún con los desafíos y los logros puedes completarlo en menos de 10 horas.

[h1]Synopsis[/h1]

[i]Portal[/i] is a very creative game constructed under limiting constraints. Students working on a game called Narbacular Drop, which has similar mechanics to Portal, were hired by Valve to continue its development. Portal became the fruit of their development. The team indicated that the limiting constraints under which they developed the game contributed to its success. The game is a first-person puzzle game, where you play as Chell, who finds herself in an eerie, pristine test chamber in  a vast laboratory building. Her antagonist is GLaDOS, a seemingly light-hearted AI, who guides you through the series of test chambers. Later, you find that GLaDOS is actually quite sinister.

[h1]Story[/h1]

I feel that Portal's story is told in a fashion that's truly unique to video games. There's a true sense that you're working toward finding answers, yet you're never expressly told to "Go here to advance story", or never told "Press X to not die". It's very hard to put into words, but the story almost feels like it's not there unless you choose to investigate and look more closely. The fact that it's told so subtly seems to make it stand out in my memory. I feel like Metroid Prime on the GameCube is very similar in this fashion.

I understand this is all vague sounding, and not really explaining the story itself, but if you've yet to play Portal, the less you know about it, the better.

[h1]Physics![/h1]

This game's core portal mechanic has to be the funnest way to get around in a video game. The game revolves around interacting with two spatially linked portals placed on flat surfaces. You use this mechanic to move objects, and yourself, in various creative ways.

The gameplay feels mindbending and visceral, since the rate at which you're accelerating when you enter a portal reflects your acceleration as you exit the other. By the end of the game, you're doing some really creative things, and there's still probably many tactics and solutions you'd never consider.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]

Personally, I found the game's difficulty to be tuned very well. I was never super frustrated, yet finding some solutions felt very satisfying.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Overall, I can see why this game is considered such a classic. Every facet of the game just works well, and the story and gameplay work very well together. I'd have to say that GLaDOS is one of the best written characters I've seen in a while. It's all in the subtlty of the writing and Ellen McLain's voice acting. A lot of games these days really need to take a queue from this game and understand that subtle story telling can have a far greater impact.

Something about this game gives me a headache and nausea every time I play it. I tried changing the resolution, windowed/fullscreen, everything. It just makes me want to puke every time. I can only get about 5 puzzles in. Last time (off steam) I think I fought through it in bursts to get about halfway through. But it's just not worth it for me.

Great game, though. That's why it's so damn frustrating.
glados is scary!

A puzzle game that redefines puzzle. Portal takes its concepts and mechanics and throws them into a world of atmosphere and desolation. Portal's use of its resources and its characters make it feel, almost like horror game at times. Living isolated within the enrichment center of a long abandoned facility, the only things that talk to you are a near broken artificial intelligence, and automatic turrets that wish to slaughter you. Already throwing you to the ground with setting and universe, Portal kicks you back to the life -by kicking you in the stomach- with it's dry wit, pleasantly dark, and always morbid humor. A winning game with a lot to do and so much happening in such a short time that's it a game you'll look to yourself playing time and time again.

Surely everyone by now has played, seen, or at least heard of Portal.

This game ended up being one of Valve's more entertaining projects, giving you the feel of a lot of the FPS (First Person Shooter) games out there, but requiring you to think and solve puzzles as you progress. These puzzles get progressively harder as the game advances, but nothing so difficult you can't figure it out with a little trial and error. GLaDOS makes for one of the best "Villains" of a game in a long time, being delightfully sadistic as the story deepens. 

After the completion of the story there are challenge chambers to complete, which are more difficult than the puzzles you encountered in the story. There is also a lot of player created content to explore, giving the game a much longer life than it otherwise would've had. Valve has once again, by keeping the community involved and letting them be creative, turned an already great product into one that will keep you entertained time and time again.

For people who like chalenges this is the game for you!!
